description: From Latin exaestuatus, passive participle of exaestuare (“to boil up”). See estuate.

verbs.description: exestuate (third-person singular simple present exestuates, present participle exestuating, simple past and past participle exestuated)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, rare) To be agitated; to boil up; to effervesce.
